resources.string: Welcome to the Banat Travel App!
Email and password should not be empty
Email and password are not valid
Password should have at least 7 characters
Tourism: Cheile Nerei–Beușnita National Park, Domogled–Valea Cernei National Park, Danube Iron Gate National Park, Semenic resort, Băile-Herculane resort
Tourism: the ruins of Trajan\'s first bridge over the Danube, the city of Orșova, the Danube\'s Iron Gates
Tourism: Theresia Bastion, Huniade Castle, Timișoara Orthodox Cathedral, Timișoara Dome, Timișoara Millennium Church, Buziaș resort
Important cities: Zrenjanin, Pančevo, Kikinda, Vršac
Tourism: Deliblato Sands, Carska Bara bog, the city of Zrenjanin, the city of Vršac
The spa town has been visited for its supposedly natural healing properties: hot springs with sulfur, chlorine, sodium, calcium, magnesium and other minerals, as well as negatively ionized air.

The capital of Caraș-Severin county was a powerful industrial location in modern Romania, but it has lost most of its importance and its economy faced a drawback after 1989. However, the city\'s economy is on an upward slope, due to serious investments in its rehabilitation.

Semenic is a ski resort in the Semenic-Cheile Carașului National Park, in the Banat region of Romania. Besides it there are many places that catch your eye. We invite you to discover the wonders of this area.

You can stop anywhere to admire paradise. On one side, rocky hills, parks and nature reserves with secular forests protected with varieties of plants and birds unique in the world. And on the other, the lazy thread of the Danube. Nature lovers will be delighted by the rare trees and shrubs, the straw colonies.
The commune is famous for its picturesque surroundings and for the fact that it attracts many tourists every year. We let you discover more about it.

Orșova is a port city on the Danube river in southwestern Romania\'s Mehedinți County. It is one of four localities in the county located in the Banat historical region. It is situated just above the Iron Gates, on the spot where the Cerna River meets the Danube. Also, the city was the site of a Roman port in Dacia Malvensis, and the site of a castrum named Dierna.

The settlement from the Buzias Depression has been known since Roman times, under the name of Ahibis. The documentary attestation is from the XIV - XV centuries and has been declared a spa town since 1819. Recaș is well-known in the world for the quality of its wines.

If you are a fan of holidays in the fresh air and you like special villages where people are happy and welcoming, a small village in Timiș County is the perfect place to recharge your batteries. Charlottenburg is the only round village in Romania.

Lugoj is a city in Timiș County, Banat, western Romania. The river Timiș divides the city into two halves, the so-called Romanian Lugoj that spreads on the right bank and the German Lugoj on the left bank. Lugoj was once a strongly fortified city that developed along the river Timiș. During the Middle Ages and eighteenth century, it was of greater relative importance than at present.

Nicknamed the Little Vienna or the City of Flowers, Timișoara is considered the informal capital city of the historical Banat. The country\'s third most populous city is the economic hub of the region, with 332 983 inhabitants as of the 2016 census, home to almost a half-million inhabitants in the metropolitan area, as well as ca. 50,000 students from over 50 countries.
The Danube is the second-longest river in Europe at 2857 km. It flows through 10 countries and is constantly changing. You’ll never get bored when you’re on the Danube!

The city was founded in the 18th century. From 1774 to 1874 Kikinda was the seat of the District of Velika Kikinda, an autonomous administrative unit of Habsburg Monarchy. Before the break-up of former Yugoslavia, hunting tourism was widespread in Kikinda. There are a number of hunting grounds in the city covering an area of 300 square kilometres (116 sq mi), mostly around the banks of the Danube-Tisa-Danube Canal, where rabbits, pheasants and deer are hunted.

Pančevo is the fourth largest city in Vojvodina by population. The city is recognized for a very rich cultural life, which is reflected in the activity of 15 cultural institutions as well as in the organization of more than 40 events per year. The city is considered to be the city of sports, because it has always been famous for its well-known athletes.

The symbol of the town is the Vršac Castle, which dates back to the mid 15th century. It stands at the top of the hill overlooking Vršac. One popular place to visit is the local family-run winery, Vinik, which produces the Vržole Red, Vržole White and Bermetto wine.

Zrenjanin is the city of bridges, youth, sports, culture, interesting architecture and people of more than twenty nationalities. The quiet little town on the banks of the Bega combines the nostalgic charm of the time when the "portion" of freedom of small traffic with the air of a handy holiday destination came from the Serbs.
